item.value: The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
Atari releases Pong, the first commercial video game on November 29, 1972.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
In 1783 Jean Pilatre de Rozier ( a Frenchman ) made the first balloon flight, reaching a peak altitude of about 500 ft, and traveling about 51/2 mi in 20 min.
More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
John Logie Baird was the inventor of the world's first working television system in Hastings, England in 1923.
If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon. He, Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin and Michael Collins were the crew of Apollo 11.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
Mount McKinley in Alaska is the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high. Alaska is also the largest state in America, it is 656,425 square miles in size.

The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
